publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3556# Cathy Peattie: Deanburn Primary School—That the Parliament congratulates all those involved in the creation of the eco-friendly Deanburn Primary School in Bo’ness; notes that features include grass roofs, its own wind turbine, a rainwater-collection system and "breathing walls" to reduce the need for artificial ventilation, and believes that the Scottish Executive should encourage others to adopt an innovative and environmentally friendly approach to designing and upgrading buildings.

S2M-3556# Cathy Peattie: Deanburn Primary School—That the Parliament congratulates all those involved in the creation of the eco-friendly Deanburn Primary School in Bo’ness; notes that features include grass roofs, its own wind turbine, a rainwater-collection system and "breathing walls" to reduce the need for artificial ventilation, and believes that the Scottish Executive should encourage others to adopt an innovative and environmentally friendly approach to designing and upgrading buildings.
S2M-3556# Deanburn Primary School (lodged on 10 November 2005) Fiona Hyslop*
S2M-3556# Deanburn Primary School (lodged on 10 November 2005) Michael Matheson*, Donald Gorrie*

S2M-3556# Deanburn Primary School (lodged on 10 November 2005) Jackie Baillie*, Shiona Baird*, Sarah Boyack*, Chris Ballance*, Helen Eadie*, Robin Harper*, Mr Mark Ruskell*, Nora Radcliffe*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Margaret Mitchell*
S2M-3556# Deanburn Primary School (lodged on 10 November 2005) Patrick Harvie*, Eleanor Scott*
S2M-3556# Deanburn Primary School (lodged on 10 November 2005) Marlyn Glen*, Pauline McNeill*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*, Trish Godman*
S2M-3556# Deanburn Primary School (lodged on 10 November 2005) Elaine Smith*
S2M-3556# Deanburn Primary School (lodged on 10 November 2005) Maureen Macmillan*
